p: Experiments were conducted in 6-week-old immunocompetent (BALB/c strain) mice inoculated with 2 × 10 5 PFU/50 μL of MAYV via the s.c. intraplantar (i.pl.) route and several analyses were performed to assess kinetics of infection (Fig. 1a). Non-infected mice (MOCK) received a 50 μL s.c. i.pl. injection of C6/36 cell culture supernatant. Figure 1b shows that MAYV-infected mice resulted in hypernociception from day 1 until day 21 after virus inoculation and this was much greater than responses observed in control littermates. At day 28, all values returned to baseline levels (Fig. 1b). Total and differential blood leukocyte analysis revealed elevated numbers of monocytes, neutrophils and lymphocytes on the MAYV-infected group, from day 1 to day 14, in comparison to non-infected controls. At day 21, all leukocyte subtypes returned to baseline values (Fig. 1c). Viable viruses were recovered from the paw at days 1 to 7 p.i (Fig. 1d), while in the popliteal lymph node (LNP) (Fig. 1e), quadriceps muscle (Fig. 1f), spleen (Fig. 1g) and serum (Fig. 1h) virus recovery occurred at days 1 and 3 post-infection. Of note, no detectable virus was recovered from the liver at any analyzed time points (data not shown).
